item.Name: Barack Obama
item.career: Senator of Illinois, Comumunity organizer, lawyer, constitutional law professor, author
item.edu: B.A. Columbia, J.D. Harvard Law School
item.description: The Presidental position is the head of state and head of government of the United States. The president leads the executive branch of the federal government and is the commander-in-chief of the United States Armed Forces.

item.Name: Joseph Biden
item.official_title: Vice President of the United States
item.edu: B.A. University of Delaware, J.D. Syracuse University
item.description: The Vice President is the first person in the presidential line of succession, and takes the Presidency upon the death, resignation, or removal of the President. They also have the power to overturn a tie in the Senate.

item.Name: John Kerry
item.official_title: Secretary of State of the United States
item.career: Navy, Lieutenant Govenor, Senator of Massachusettes
item.description: The Secretary of State is a senior official in the Federal Government of the United States heading the Department of State. The incumbent is principally concerned with foreign affairs and is considered to be the U.S. equivalent of a foreign minister.

item.Name: Neal Wolin
item.edu: B.A. Yale, M.S. Oxford, J.D. Yale Law
item.description: The Secretary of the Treasury is the head of the US Department of the Treasury, which is concerned with financial and monetary matters, and also with some issues of national security and defense.

item.Name: Leon Panetta
item.career: Director of the CIA, Lawyer, professor, politician, army
item.description: The Secretary of Defense is the leader and chief executive officer of the Department of Defense, an Executive Department of the Government of the USA.

item.Name: Eric Holder
item.description: The Attorney General is is the head of the United States Department of Justice and is concerned with legal affairs. Is also the chief law enforcement officer of the United States government. The attorney general is considered to be the chief lawyer of the U.S. government.

item.Name: Ken Salazar
item.career: Lawyer, Attorney General and Senator of Colorado
item.edu: BA Colorado College, JD University of Michigan
item.description: The Secretary of the Interior is the head of the Department of the Interior which oversees such agencies as the Bureau of Land Management, the United States Geological Survey, and the National Park Service. It's main goals are to protect America’s natural resources and heritage, honors it's cultures and tribal communities, and supply the energy to power the future.

item.Name: Tom Vilsack
item.edu: BA Hamilton College, JD Albany Law School
item.description: The Secretary of Agriculture is the head of the Department of Agriculture, whose main goal is to expand economic opportunity through innovation, helping rural America to thrive; to promote agriculture production sustainability that better nourishes Americans while also helping feed others throughout the world; and to preserve and conserve our Nation's natural resources through restored forests, improved watersheds, and healthy private working lands.

item.Name: Rebecca Blank
item.career: Dean at U Michigan, Professor, Research director
item.edu: BA University of Minnesota, PHD Economics MIT
item.description: The Secretary of Commerce is the head of the U.S. Department of Commerce promotes job creation, economic growth, sustainable development and improved standards of living for all Americans by working in partnership with businesses, universities, communities and our nation’s workers.

item.Name: Seth Harris
item.career: Professor, Program Director at NY Law School
item.edu: BS Cornell University, JD NY Law
item.description: The Secretary of Labor exercises control over the department and enforces and suggests laws involving unions, the workplace, and all other issues involving any form of business-person controversies. The department is also concerned with occupational safety, wage and hour standards, unemployment insurance benefits, re-employment services, and some economic statistics

item.Name: Kathleen Sebelius
item.official_title: Secretary of Health and Human Services
item.department: Department of Health and Human Services
item.edu: BA Trinity Washington University, MPA U Kansas
item.description: This Cabinet department of the United States government has the goal of protecting the health of all Americans and providing essential human services.

item.Name: Shaun Donovan
item.official_title: Secretary of Housing and Urban Development
item.department: Department of Housing and Urban Development
item.career: Commissioner of NYC Department of Housing Preservation and Development
item.description: The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development is the head of the Department of Housing and Urban Development. Its mission is "to increase homeownership, support community development and increase access to affordable housing free from discrimination."

item.Name: Ray LaHood
item.career: Social studies teacher, Representative from Illinois
item.description: The Secretary of Transportation is in charge of the Department of Transportation. It's mission is "to develop and coordinate policies that will provide an efficient and economical national transportation system, with due regard for need, the environment, and the national defense."

item.Name: Steven Chu
item.edu: BA mathematics BS physics University of Rochester, PHD UC Berkeley
item.description: The Secretary of Energy is the head of the Department of Energy who's goal originally focused on energy production and regulation. The emphasis soon shifted to developing technology for better, more efficient energy sources as well as energy education. After the end of the Cold War, the department's attention also turned toward radioactive waste disposal and maintenance of environmental quality.

item.Name: Arne Duncan
item.career: Professional basketball player, CEO of Chicago Public Schools
item.description: The Department of Education has four main functions: to establish policies related to federal education funding, administer distribution of funds and monitor their use, collect data and oversee research on America's schools, identifies major issues in education and focus national attention on them, and enforce federal laws prohibiting discrimination in programs that receive federal funds.

item.Name: Eric Shinseki
item.career: Vietnam war veteran, Army Chief of Staff
item.edu: BS US Military Academy, MA English Duke
item.description: The Secretary of Veterans Affairs is the head of the Department of Veterans Affairs, the department concerned with veterans' benefits and related matters.

item.Name: Janet Napolitano
item.career: Lawyer, Attorney General and Govenor of Arizona
item.edu: BA Santa Clara University, JD University of Virginia
item.description: The Secretary of Homeland Security is the head of the Department of Homeland Security, the body concerned with protecting the American homeland and the safety of American citizens.
